message.content:
<<<api>>>: DataOutputStream.write
<<<code>>>: public byte[] toByteArray() {
    try {
        ByteArrayOutputStream realOutputStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
        DataOutputStream dout = new DataOutputStream(realOutputStream);
        dout.writeUTF(dataObject.getClass().toString());
        dout.writeUTF(recordid);
        System.out.println("Recordid: " + recordid + "|" +  dout.hashCode());
        dout.flush();
        System.out.println("Recordid: " + recordid + "|" +  dout.hashCode());
        ByteArrayOutputStream objectStream = dataObject.toByteArrayOutputStream();
        dout.write(objectStream.toByteArray());
        dout.close();
        objectStream.close();
        return realOutputStream.toByteArray();
    } catch (IOException e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
        return null;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code you provided should work correctly. The DataOutputStream is writing the data to the ByteArrayOutputStream, and then you can retrieve the concatenated byte array using `realOutputStream.toByteArray()`. The `dout.flush()` method ensures that any buffered data is written to the underlying stream. If you are not seeing the expected output, please check if there are any errors or exceptions being thrown that may be affecting the behavior of the code.
